aboutMe.title: About <1>Me</1>
history: I'm Lucas Reis, a computer engineer graduated from the Federal University of Pernambuco (UFPE), passionate about building intelligent and scalable solutions.

Originally from Bahia, I moved to Recife at the age of 18 to pursue my academic and professional goals in technology. Since then, I’ve gained solid experience in data science, MLOps, and machine learning engineering, handling projects from data collection to deployment.

During my undergraduate studies, I joined research projects on 5G networks in collaboration with CIN/Motorola and worked on quantum neural networks through a PIBIC scholarship. I also served as vice president of the Quantum Computing Academic League (LACIQ), promoting research and industry engagement.

Currently, I focus on developing robust data pipelines, predictive models, and machine learning systems ready for production. I plan to pursue a master's degree in computer science with a focus on time series forecasting.
I’m comfortable working across the entire data project lifecycle and committed to delivering impactful, ethical, and technically sound solutions.

projects.title: How Much Does Breakfast Cost?
projects.desc:
Coffee and eggs have become more expensive...

But what about the rest of breakfast?

This project started with that question. I developed a complete solution to forecast, over the next 6 months, the prices of key breakfast foods. Everything was automated using machine learning, scraping, data visualization and APIs.

projects.title: Personal Finance Chatbot
projects.desc:
A WhatsApp chatbot that helps you manage your finances through conversation.

It allows you to log expenses, track debts, set budgets, and get financial tips in a fast, simple, and accessible way.

projects.title: Industrial Product Scraper
projects.desc:
An automated tool to extract and structure product data from industrial websites.

It turns unstructured and messy pages into clean, organized information ready for catalog systems and market analysis.

projects.title: Evolvium
projects.desc:
A lightweight Python library that uses genetic algorithms to solve optimization problems.

Simple to use and ideal for experimentation or real-world projects that need good solutions without exact formulas.

projects.title: 8 Queens with Genetic Algorithms
projects.desc:
An interactive simulation of the classic 8 queens problem using genetic algorithms.

It’s a fun and visual way to understand how evolutionary algorithms build solutions over time.

projects.title: Ybý-Mokoĩ
projects.desc:
A 2D action RPG inspired by Tupi-Guarani mythology.

The player battles legendary creatures, collects items like guaraná and açaí, and experiences the story behind the origin of night. A creative and educational way to celebrate Indigenous culture through engaging gameplay.

projects.title: Autonomous Agent with Search Algorithms
projects.desc:
A simulation where an agent must find the best path in an environment full of obstacles.

I implemented and compared different search strategies, including A*, greedy search, and even genetic algorithms, all within an intuitive visual interface.

projects.title: Word Search Generator
projects.desc:
A simple Python app to create personalized word search puzzles.

Perfect for educators, students, or anyone looking to quickly build educational games and fun printable activities.
